citations.narrative:
The licensee was unable to provide documentation for the results of a fecal test for a 5-year-old female Miniature Golden
Doodle (#9261). Records indicate that a fecal screening test was performed on March 20, 2024 but no results were found.
Failure to document screening test results may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if animals are
receiving adequate veterinary care. Medical records must be maintained and include the dates and findings/results of all
screening, routine, or other required or recommended test or examination. Correct by documenting the results of all
testing and ensure that records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 19-JULY-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee was unable to provide documentation for the results of a fecal test for a 5-year-old female Miniature Golden 
Doodle (#9261). Records indicate that a fecal screening test was performed on March 20, 2024 but no results were found. 
Failure to document screening test results may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if animals are 
receiving adequate veterinary care. Medical records must be maintained and include the dates and findings/results of all 
screening, routine, or other required or recommended test or examination. Correct by documenting the results of all 
testing and ensure that records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 19-JULY-2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
